dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from the American, Mr. Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted to know if you'd give us a statement.   We hear you're here to work on the Julia Wolf case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  I don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never tried to kid you reporters -- I'm telling  you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife's on a bender.  I'm trying to sober her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora sticks up her nose, laughs, goes over to  the table.  WE PAN as Nick leads the reporters  there too.  Quinn and one or two of the others  also are imbibing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick (as they get to the table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- relax -- (then to Nora) Give them a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick picks up a drink, already poured for  himself.   Nick (looking at the glass in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hand) What small glasses you have, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes off toward the service pantry with  the drink in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, isn't he working on a case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  He's working on a case of Scotch.  Pitch  in and help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes off toward the service pantry.   Mrs. Quinn comes up with her glass.  Quinn  looks appreciatingly after Nora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't she grand?  I take off my hat to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a tiny room with cupboards, a sink and  a miniature Frigidaire.  Nick is getting ice cubes out of a tray.  Nora comes in with a  glass in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better order some food. (to Nick - as she takes receiver)  That sounds like an interesting case.  Wouldn't  you like to take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't the time.  I'm much too busy seeing that  you don't lose any of the money I married you for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talks to Nick as she waits to get the connection.  She watches him covertly as she she is sure that he would love to go back to "sleuthing", and she'd enjoy being in on it with him...she is trying to sound him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a good case.  Girl mysteriously murder- ed.  No one knows who did it.  They haven't found any clues yet -- no gun -- no fingerprints --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if they've --  (He looks at Nora and suddenly realizes  that he is getting interested.  He jerks  himself out of it)  I don't want to hear anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the ice and Nora's drink. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drains the glass and puts it down. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out as Nora turns laughing to the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen - I want a whole flock or sandwiches --

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM.
dialogues.text: Nick comes in with the ice.  The doorbell rings.  Nick puts down the ice and starts for  the door. As the CAMERA TRUCKS with him he passes the telephone table.  Foster is sitt- ing there.  The radio music has put him in a  sentimental mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to telephone my mother... wish her a  Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES TO PAN WITH HIM as he goes on to the door.  Just as he is about to open it, he hears Foster's voice, o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long distance -- give me San Francisco --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks off, winces a little, good-humored- ly. Then he opens the door and is surprised  to see Dorothy Wynant standing there.  She is white-lipped, miserable and desperate.  Nick looks at her, a little worried by her  harassed look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to see you alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick realizes that something is definitely  the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns as he hears Quinn's voice.

dialogues.speaker: GUESTS AND REPORTERS.
dialogues.text: Quinn is coming toward them, a drink in his hand.  His eyes are fixed on Dorothy.  The two reporters also are coming forward.  Their  curiosity quite different from Quinn's, for they realize her identity and the possibili- ties of a story. Nick (rushing her toward the bedroom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and she goes in.  Nick is about to follow her when Quinn stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to bounce it on my knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which knee?  Could I touch it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick laughs and enters the bedroom.  Quinn  tries to follow, as do the reporters who have come up, but Nick shuts the door in their  faces.  Quinn, startled, knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy is standing near the bed.  She holds  herself taut and stiff.  She is determined  that she is going to sacrifice herself to  save her father.  Nick comes up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy (she pulls a gun from her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: muff) There. (she throws it on the bed.  Nick looks  at it, and then back at her. His look  is very cool and unexcited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to tell me?  That you did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy (she has her story all set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and she speaks with very convincing  fervor) Yes.  I hated her for coming between my mother and father.  She kept me from seeing my father.  I went down there to ask her where he was.  She  wouldn't tell me, and I shot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: briskness) Where did you hit her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good shot you are. What did she do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she make any sound?  Didn't scream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the horror of it makes her inarticulate) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?  People fall toward a shot, you know... not back from it.  I knew you were lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy breaks down, realizing that her attempt to take the blame is futile.  Nick  goes and holds her comfortingly in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it in a pawn shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point Nora enters.  She holds a drink in her hand.  Nick looks up -- makes a little grimace at Nora.  Dorothy turns and sees her. She pulls away a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is awful of me -- to make a nuisance of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a dope.  Have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy tries wanly to smile. Dorothy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fumbles in her bag to find her powder. Nick is looking curiously at the gun, turn- ing it over in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora (to Dorothy -- pointing to dressing table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's powder and stuff over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick (looking up -- indicating drink Nora has)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora sees the gun now, is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brought it in. (slips it into the drawer of a table)  Trying to make me believe she did it. Nora (as he puts the gun away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, 'til I find out if it's the gun Julia  Wolf was killed with. (he starts for the door to the living room) Keep her in here, and don't let those reporters  see her. They might believe her. He goes out the door, and closes it hastily  behind him.  Nora goes toward Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: There is a hotel service table, piled high  with food, in the room.  The people here all  eating, standing around with drinks in their  hands.  As soon as Nick opens the door to come  out, the reporters pounce on him. First Reporter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (the first reporter makes a move to go  past Nick to the bedroom, Nick bars the way) Here...here.  She doesn't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you said you weren't on the case.  He goes off quickly toward the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.  I don't know a thing about it, and I don't care a thing about it.  All I want is a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster has at last been able to get his  mother in San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporter comes rapidly into the shot.  He  tries to take the telephone from the other man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just got San Francisco ... (into phone)  How are you, Ma?  Reporter (taking the phone from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: him, he speaks into it)  Get off the line, will you, Ma?  I got some business. (he jiggles the hook for the operator)  Give me Drydock 4 - 8000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn is standing beside Nick.  The doorbell rings. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to reporter over at telephone) Hey, don't do that!  (he is pouring a drink)  Now don't tell your paper that I'm working on  anything, 'cause I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick goes offscene toward the door.  The bell rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just working on that little gal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick opens the door.  Mimi and Gilbert are  outside. Mimi instantly rushes in greets him effusively. Gilbert is left standing in the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you about something very im- portant. The first reporter has forgotten his telephone  call. He is all ears.  Nick looks around desperately, and takes Mimi roughly by the  arm and rushes her into a doorway next to the door of the bedroom. Nick

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM.
dialogues.text: As Nick brings Mimi into the bathroom, she  looks around; bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  This is the only place we can be alone; Won't you sit down? He waves airily off scene, presumably toward  the seat, Mimi follows the line of his hand,  looks, starts and gives him a cutting look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilbert is standing hesitantly in the door- way. The first reporter suddenly sees him.  He hasn't noticed him before.  He goes quick- ly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, Mr. Wynant. (he takes Gilbert cordially but firmly  by the arm and brings him into the room) My name is Diamond. Come on in and have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter-of-fact, I don't either. I'd much rather talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for a quiet corner -

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM.
dialogues.text: Mimi and Nick are sitting on the edge of the  tub. Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde Wynant's crazy... absolutely crazy to stay away at a time like this. No wonder the police think  he has something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know he didn't, but I wish I could find him...  I have something very important to tell him. Macaulay won't help at all.  He thinks I just want money. Nick (smiling at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choosing to regard this as a joke) You're always teasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the bathroom opens.  Foster starts  to come in. He stops suddenly as he sees Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs hurriedly out.  Mimi moves closer to Nick, takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you will help me find Clyde -- won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mimi, there are a thousand detectives in New York.  Hire one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he knows you.  All you have to do is get in touch with him, and tell him that Mimi says every- thing is all right... but that I've got to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you again, I don't want any part of it.  (he goes and opens the door which  connects with the bedroom)  Now you take Dorothy home and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi pushes into the bedroom, past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy and Nora are sitting on the bed.  Asta is between them.  Dorothy is patting  Asta, still looking very subdued and unhappy. Nora holds out the glass toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you finish this, you'll feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mirror in back of them, we see Mimi coming toward Dorothy, a look of fury on her face.  Dorothy looks up at her Mother as she comes into the  scene, a little terrified by  her Mother's expression.  Mimi comes right  to Dorothy and stands over her.  She is sure  that Dorothy has told Nick about the watch  chain. Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell him?  What did you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy doesn't answer.  Her Mother slaps  her viciously, repeating the question.  Nick comes up from behind Mimi and pulls her away. Nora puts a protecting arm around Dorothy.  There is a second of silence as Dorothy and Mimi face each other, all of their mutual antagonism in their eyes.  Asta starts bark- ing.  Nora quiets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't tell me a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you didn't bring your whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited I didn't know what I was doing.  Come on, Dorothy, we'll go home. Nora (sharply to Mimi)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll go home if she wants to. (she turns with warm affection to Dorothy) You can stay here you know.  There's plenty of room and we'd love to have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up to go.  Mimi looks around. Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is the last straw) Gilbert!  Is he here too? (he starts toward the living room) We might as well be living in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilbert is sitting in a corner of the  room with the two reporters.  They  have their pencils out, taking down the  rapid flow of words that come from Gil- bert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a physiological as well as a psychological angle in my father's relationship with Julia Wolf that the police have overlooked.  And I  think it explains everything.  You see, my  father was a sexogenarian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply interested, not knowing the  meaning of the word) He was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking very solemnly - thinking it is some sex perversion)  Sexogerarian, eh?  Yes.  Yes.  But I can't put that in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how they are... sex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just say he was sixty years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporter gets up, furious.  He throws his pad to the floor.  Nick comes into the scene.  He goes to Gilbert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gilbert - amused at the reporter's  discomfort) Come on, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Gilbert by the arm and pushes him  into the bedroom and closes the door on him.  The telephone starts to ring. The two reporters follow Nick as he goes toward the telephone. 2nd Reporter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.... give me a break.  You owe it to me after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I haven't a thing to do with it. (He picks up the telephone.  The 2nd reporter listens, unashamed)  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in a room telephoning.  The background  is not distinguishable.  He is evidently  talking for the effect on someone else in the  room whom we do not see.  He looks at the  man out of the corner or his eye as he  talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Charles, I'd like to lay a proposition before  you.  I can't discuss it over the telephone, but if you'll give me half an hour of your time... it's about the Julia Wolf....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that a hand comes in, covers the mouth- piece, preventing any further conversation.  Nunheim, still in this big closeup, looks  o.s, at the invisible man and grins sardoni- cally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning) Hello... hello...         Then as he gets no answer, he hangs up.  The 2nd reporter jumps to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a man trying to sell me insurance.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Nora comes out of the bedroom door.  Quinn  comes up to her.  Mrs. Quinn, starts listen- ing. Quinn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two reporters, without a word, grab  their hats and coats and rush out. Quinn, too, brazenly starts to breeze past his  wife and follow them.  Mrs. Quinn steps in front of him, slaps his face. Foster, again at the phone, whines out:  "Hello, Ma!"  And simultaneously, during this confusion, the radio starts to play "Silent Night, Peaceful Night" -- as the police captain, the pug, Face Peppler, and all others immediately join in with the song.  They are all pretty tight by this time and sing at the top of their lungs.  The effect desired is a screwy climax to what has been quite a hectic, screwy situation. CAMERA PANS WITH NORA as she takes it all in at a quick glance and walks over to Nick. She puts her arms around him.  He looks down at her, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Nickie, 'cause you know such lovely people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is about an hour later the bedroom is dark  for a second. Then, Nora on one side of the big double bed, pulls on the light on the small table beside her. She sits up a little and looks over at Nick. He is soundly sleeping, his  face toward her. She has Dorothy on her mind and can't sleep and she wants company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! (he doesn't stir)   Nick! (he looks sleepily at her) Are you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you'd like to go back to detecting  once in a while, just for the fun of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a drink would help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it would if I took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK as he gets up out of bed and  goes to the bureau where there is a bottle and  a glass. Asta jumps down and follows him. Nick  pours himself a drink. Asta stands there,  licking Nick's bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody says you were a grand detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow I'll buy you a whole lot of detective stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora is determined to get Nick to help Dorothy.  She tries another approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That poor girl is in a tough spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do to help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asta jumps on the bed, goes and curls himself  up at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks you can. It wouldn't hurt you to find out if you could, would it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting back into the bed) Darling, my guess is that Wynant killed Julia and  Dorothy knows it. And the police'll catch him without my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I would like that drink. (Nick gets up again and goes to get her  a drink) I'll give you your Christmas present now if you'll give me mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings her the drink.  She takes it from  him and he gets into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to go beck to sleep) Breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to give me?  I hope I don't like  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to keep them anyway. The man at the  Aquarium said that he wouldn't take them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora looks over at him, disgusted. She puts  down the drink and pulls out the light. After a second, there is a knock heard from the next room. Nora pulls on the light. She turns to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks up.  The knock comes again.  Nora gets  up, takes a robe from the foot of the bed, pulls  it on and goes out.  As she does so, Nick  reaches over, takes her drink and finishes it,  then turns over again to go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora has put on the lights as she came through  the room.  She opens the door. Joe Morelli is standing outside. He wears a black derby hat,  which he doesn't remove and he has his hands  in the pockets of his close fitting black over- coat. Nora looks at him with lively curiosity.  She is too fond of adventure as well as too brave  to scream when she sees his menacing figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his manner is very urgent)  I gotta talk to him... that's all.  But I gotta do  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora looks at him for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait here.  I'll tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick!  Nick! (Nick stirs and opens his eyes)  There's someone to she you,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) That's great.  I was afraid I'd have to go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as Nora moves away to get back into bed,  we see Morelli has followed her into the bedroom and is standing pointing a gun directly at Nick, with a menacing intentness in his whole body.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP.
dialogues.text: Nora, entirely unconscious of Morelli's  presence and the gun in his hand, swings into bed beside Nick.  Nick is looking fixedly at the gun.  Nora looks at him,  amused by his expression, not knowing the  cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the funniest look on your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows the line of Nick's gaze, and her  eyes pop with amazement as she sees Morelli  with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSEUP ON MORELLI.
dialogues.text: He holds the gun leveled at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta talk to you.  I want you to tell me  something and I want you to give it to me straight.  Get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind putting that gun away?  My wife  doesn't care, but I'm in a delicate condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora looks at Nick, appreciating his humor  in the midst of his danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) You idiot! (Asta begins barking at Morelli) Asta! Stop that!  Get down! (she chases him off the bed.  Asta jumps down out of sight. Morelli still has  his pistol pointed at Nick.) Now, stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Morelli - seeing that Asta is down)  All right... shoot!  (then realizing the double meaning, he  corrects himself)  I mean... what's on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to tell me you're tough.  I heard about you. (He puts the gun in his overcoat pocket)  I'm Joe Morelli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora watches the scene between the two  men.  She is excited, but apparently not  frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen her in three months.  We were all washed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have any reason to hurt her.  She was  always on the up and up with me.  But that dirty  little Nunheim -- he got sore cause I clicked with  her and he didn't, so he put the finger on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all swell.  Only you're peddling your fish  in the wrong market. I've got nothing to do with it. Morelli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his intense excitement increasing)  Listen.  "Studsy" Burke told me you used to be O.K. That's why I'm here. Do  they....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a tone of polite enquiry)  How is Studsy?  I didn't know he was out of stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conversationally) He's all right. He'd like to see you. But listen...  What's the law doing to me?  Do they think I did it,  or is it just something else to pin on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd tell you if I knew. But I'm not in this.  Ask the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) That'd be very smart.  That'd be the smartest thing I ever did. Me that a police captain's been in a  hospital three weeks on account we had an argument. The boys would like to have me come in and ask  questions.  They'd like it right down to the end of their blackjacks.  Now I come to you on the level. Studsy says you're on the level.  Be on the level. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am on the level. If I knew anything I'd....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the SOUND TRACK there is a sound of  knuckles rapping sharply on the door.  Morelli's gun is in his hand before the  rapping stops.  His eyes seem to move in  all directions at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a snarl to Nick) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging his shoulders) This is your party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the knuckles come again, and  someone speaks outside. Guild's voice (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he raises his gun to fire at Nick) You two-timing -- Nick shoves Nora's face, knocking her out of  bed and across the room with his left hand, and  throws a pillow at Morelli with his right just  as Morelli fires.  Nick sprawls out of bed,  making a dive for Morelli and catching his  ankle. The two men fall to the floor. Morelli  clubs Nick with his revolver, and Nick fights  him with his one free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild, two policemen, and the hotel manager rush  into the room.  They pitch in and drag Nick  and Morelli apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is in a faint as Nick, comes quickly up  to her.  The hotel manager follows him and  stands looking down solicitously. Nick leans down over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. She was in the line of fire.  (turns, points to liquor bottle) Hand me that bottle. (turns back to Nora, begins working on her) Better get a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel manager goes quickly out. Nick  tries to get Nora to take a drink of whisky. She opens her eyes. She puts her hand up to  her cheek where Nick hit her.  Then, as Nick watches her anxiously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You darn fool -- you didn't have to knock me out.  I knew you'd take him, but I wanted to see you do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morelli is standing handcuffed between the officers.  Guild looks admiringly at Nora as Nick is helping her to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a gal with hair on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick pulls Nora up, she looks at the coat  of his pyjamas, where a streak of blood has  started to come through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick follows her eyes down. For the first time  he realizes that the bullet has touched him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.  It just grazed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, quick -- get into bed.  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure -- I don't even feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get some towels. (she goes quickly into the bathroom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets into bed.  Guild comes over - looks at the wound.  The CAMERA PANS AWAY from  Morelli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was close, but you're all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the SOUND TRACK we hear the policeman  slap Morelli's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora comes back from the bathroom with some  towels.  Nick puts a towel over the wound,  and sits propped up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right. Don't let's fuss till the  doctor comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora goes out of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you people happen to pop in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear this is getting to be sort of a meeting  place for the Wynant family, so we figure we'll  stick around in case the old man himself shows up.  Then we seen him... (he points to Morelli) ...sneak in and we decide to come up.  And pretty  lucky for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drily)  Yes.  I might not have been shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were looking for this bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! (then to Nick - indicating Morelli) This guy a friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to tell me he didn't kill Julia Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he think it was to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you say - (to policeman)  Go on, Bob. The policeman starts to search the room. Guild decides to change his tactics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mr. Charles.  I guess we're both of us going  about this wrong.  I don't want to get tough with you,  and I guess you don't want to get tough with me.  There's just one one question I want to ask you. Are  you going to swear to the complaint of him shooting  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's another one I can't answer right now. Maybe it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora comes over with the drink for Nick.  She  hands it to him, as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that man doing in my drawers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, hearing this, chokes on his drink.

dialogues.speaker: BUREAU
dialogues.text: Bob is searching in the drawers of the bureau.  He finds the pistol that Nick left there and  brings it to Guild. CAMERA PANS HIM OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild takes the gun, looks at it and turns to Nick.  Nick - not knowing whether or not the gun  is evidence, is slightly apprehensive.  He watches  Guild closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got a pistol permit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever heard of the Sullivan Act?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora (a little confused about the  different acts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild gives her a sharp look, and turns  again to Nick. Guild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to try to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oke.  There's plenty of time. I guess we got to ask you a lot more questions than we counted on.  We'll  come up tomorrow when you're feeling better. (He turns to the officers and Morelli) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four men go out. CAMERA MOVES UP FOR  CLOSEUP OF NICK AND NORA.  She is sitting beside Nick on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish that doctor'd come.  How do you feel? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be here.  Give him time to get his trousers on.  Where's Asta?  (calling) Asta!  Asta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dog comes slowly out from under the  bureau, looking a little scared and shame- faced.  He comes toward Nick, jumps on the bed beside him and licks his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Asta) You're a fine watch dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got more sense than you have.  Thank Heaven you're not on this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On it!  I'm in it ... They think I did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick throws a pillow at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is noon. The sun is streaming in. Most of the bells on the Christmas tree have been broken. There is one large ball still intact. Over the SOUND TRACK we hear the pop of an air rifle.  The big ball splinters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK to show Nick lying on  the sofa in a dressing gown, with the air rifle  in his hand.  He uses only his right hand on the rifle.  Across his chest, on the left, there is the indication of bandaging underneath  his pajamas. On the floor beside him are piles of newspapers.  The telephone is on a table  near his hand. The room is littered with tissue paper and ribbon from the opened  Christmas presents. There is a breakfast table  at one side, with the emptied dishes covered  by a napkin.  Nora is sitting smoking.  She is wearing a very lovely fur coat over her  negligee.  She is reading a tabloid newspaper, the headlines and pictures of which exploit  the Julia Wolf murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking fondly at the rifle)  This is the nicest present I ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora puts down her paper.  She comes over to  Nick on the sofa.  She has a bunch of holiday telegrams in her hand. She starts to pick up the newspapers which almost cover Nick.  She  has a very lovely wrist watch on.  Nick sees  it -- takes her hand and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must admit I have good taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I know all they know about the murder. And  I'm a great hero.  The Tribune said I was shot twice. As he talks, Nora throws the papers to the floor and sits down at the other end of the couch, putting her slippered feet comfortably in Nick's lap. She starts to open, the telegrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read you were shot five times in the tabloids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.  He never came near my tabloids.  (he takes aim again with his gun)  That's one thing I always protect... my tabloids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he is just ready to shoot, the CAMERA PANS over to his target.  It is a large balloon that Asta is chasing around the room.  We hear the "pop" of the rifle and the balloon ex- plodes, to Asta's astonishment and chagrin.  Asta starts looking for the lost balloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone rings - Nick reaches over and  picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora reads the telegrams and hands them to  Nick at the other end of the sofa as she  finishes.  He takes them as she gives them to him, and throws them on the floor without  looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she reads one) Season's Greetings.  The Mallorys.  (she hands it to Nick. She is distressed)  I forgot all about them. She opens another telegram.  Nick throws the first to the floor.  He looks at Nora in her fur coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stifling, but it's so pretty. (she hands him another telegram) The Kirbys. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it and dropping it on the floor)  Is that another Christmas present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I give it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Again this is news to Nick, but he takes it  philosophically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tickles him with her foot.  Then she  hands him another telegram, which suffers the  same fate.  Nick cocks his gun again, prepar- ing to shoot.  Nora has opened another tele- gram.  Her manner changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, listen.  From Clyde Wynant! (Nick puts down his rifle, all attention. Nora reads it aloud)  "Will you take charge of investigation on Julia  Wolf murder.  Communicate with Herbert Macaulay".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting out his hand for it) Let's see.  Where's it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at it as she hands it over)  Philadelphia. (Nick is examining the telegram.  The doorbell rings.  Nora starts for the door, talking as she goes) Then he didn't do it, did he, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still on way to door) He wouldn't ask you to handle it if he were  guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guess is as good as mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh take it!  Please take it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this time she is at the door. She opens the door to Macaulay. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. I'm afraid this isn't a very "Merry Christmas" for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Macaulay comes in and goes to Nick. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to bother you when you're laid up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asta, delighted to see a visitor, jumps all over Macaulay. Macauley is a little discon- certed by all this attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a ball and the dog chases it out of the scene. Macaulay sits down near Nick. Asta comes back into the scene. He deposits the ball near Macaulay's chair and stands looking eagerly up at him. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down and throws the ball for Asta. Beside him on the floor is a miniature fire  hydrant  He looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks down and sees it for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macaulay, a little troubled, looks down at it, and then unostentatiously moves his leg and his chair out of the danger zone.  Asta  returns, playfully and affectionately, with the ball again.  Macaulay, with a forced  smile, throws it for him again.  Then Macaulay turns to Nick, reaching in his pocket for a  telegram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got word from Wynant this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did we. (correcting herself - indicating Nick) I mean, Sherlock here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hands Macaulay his telegram from Wynant.  Macaulay reads it and looks at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the chances of getting you to do what he  wants? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it help any if I could persuade him to meet you? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me a code message to insert in the Times,  in case I wanted to get in touch with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't hurt to put it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora beams. The telephone rings.  Nick picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done that already. He should appear, you  know.  It doesn't look well... his staying away at a time like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in telephone) Hello.... oh, just a minute. (holding out the phone to Macaulay) Police departent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he looks surprised but takes the phone) Hello....  (his face changes... he is startled) Where?  In Allentown. (he consults his watch) Yes... When is the next train?  Right - I'll get that. (he slowly puts up the phone and turns  to Nick and Nora) Wynant's tried to commit suicide. They want me to come down and identify him. (slowly he picks up his hat) I guess this changes the whole story,  doesn't it?  That looks like an admission of  guilt.  And I had such hopes.  I thought if you got  on the case, you'd be able to clear him.  I thought  that Mimi.... the way she acted... I was sure that....  (he sighs) Oh, well, well... it's no use thinking of it now. I'm sorry to have wasted so much of your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes quickly out.  Nora looks after him,  and then turns to Nick.  She is evidently depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's that. (Nick starts to get up off the sofa) Stay there, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to hurt me to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk as if I were Asta. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, hard guy.  Get up and bleed on the rugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks over to pour a drink.  Nora sits down and Asta comes and puts his head on her  knees looking sadly up at her. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting Asta) What's the trouble, Asta?  Your balloon busted?  So's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mystery's all gone. And I wanted you to find  out who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his drink, casually, as is  characteristic) Maybe I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe he did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason.  Just a hunch.  But I'm going to find out. (he starts to untie his robe)  I'm tired of being pushed around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling her jaw - standing up suddenly) So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Watson, we're going places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he strides into the bedroom, Nora striding  in perfect imitation after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Nora come through the door.  They have Asta on a leash.  Guild steps up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Lieutenant - (Asta pulls her violently toward the curb. She goes after him, out of the scene, calling back apologetically) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild and Nick follow Nora more slowly to the  curb.  Guild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick)  You oughtn't to play this trick on me.  Running  out when I was giving you time to rest up before  I asked you those questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't a gun any more.  The firing pin's busted - the - (he breaks off)  Don't waste time talking about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They join Nora.  She listens eagerly, not taking her eyes from Nick and Guild. Through the whole scene, as they walk down the block, when Asta pulls on the leash Nora stops with him, and the two men, as a matter of course, stop and wait for Nora, none of them ever looking at Asta. (IT IS A TRUCKING SHOT ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man to man, Mr. Charles, are you working on this case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind telling you I'd rather have you  working with us than against us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bargain then.  Anything you want to know? The leash tightens up and starts to pull Nora ahead.  The two men quicken their steps to  keep pace with her.  (They are walking along  a quiet street in the East Fifties, so that there is not much traffic, and not many people.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's a phoney.  The men didn't even have  to go down. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it might be.  From now on, they're  going to think that every thin man over six  feet with white hair is Wynant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the leash pulls Nora over to the  curb.  The three, without interrupting their conversation, stand still, waiting.  Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that Wynant did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he planned, something.  He shut  up his apartment and his shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Couldn't find a thing. This is the way we figure it.  Wynant goes to Julia's apartment. He finds Morelli there... sees she's two-timing him. They have a fight. But he figures he don't want to do anything then.... Morelli might squeal.  So he goes away. He don't let his lawyer know any- thing has happened... he lets him go ahead and and hand over money to Julia to give to him, so that Julia will think it's all blown over. Then, when  she don't expect it... he lets her have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asta completes his investigation and starts off  down the street again the three follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty will get you a hundred that he didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one thing, he was too absent-minded to hold a  grudge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got that far yet.  But I don't think  that everything points to Wynant.  What about  the alibis? Guild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all O.K.  Mrs. Jorgensen, the boy,  Dorothy, Macaulay... even Morelli... we had to let  him go.  Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check on that. (he turns to Nora)  I'm afraid this is kinder dull for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dull... I'm sitting on the edge of my chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asta sees another hydrant and makes for it.  But Nora is too interested to stop.  She drags him on. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's all right.  We know all about him.  He does a little stooling for us every once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know he was hanging around Julia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hadn't thought of this) Let's go and see. (he motions to a passing taxi) Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi drives up.  Nora starts to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may be a little rough - you'd better let us go alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch me letting you go alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs determinedly in, pulling Asta  after her.  Guild starts to follow, but  Nick pulls him away.  He closes the door  of the taxi and speaks to the driver:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab starts off.  Nora shakes her fist back at Nick. Nick charmingly lifts his hat and throws her a kiss, as Guild hails another  passing cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the fourth floor of a dark, damp building.  The noise of the Sixth Avenue El can be heard  even in the hallway.  Guild and Nick come to the door.  Guild knocks.  There are sounds of hurried movement inside the room, then a  voice calls, in an irritated tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunheim hastily unlocks and opens the door. He has no coat on - he is evidently frighten- ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't expecting you, Lieutenant.  You said  you'd phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild touches Nick's elbow with his hand,  and they go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is shabby and dirty, with clothing,  newspapers and dirty dishes sitting around. Through an open door, the bedroom, with an unmade bed, can be seen.  In an alcove there  is a sink and a stove.  Marian is standing there with a sizzling skillet in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is wearing a rumpled pink kimono and frayed pink mules with lop-sided bows on them. She stares sullenly at Guild and Nick as they come in.  Guild does not introduce Nick to Nunheim, or even look at Marian.  He keeps his  hat on, and Nick, seeing him, follows his example.  Guild pushes some clothing out of the way to make a place for himself at the  end of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick removes some newspaper from a rocking chair and sits down.  Nunheim goes over to a table where there is about two inches of whiskey in a pint bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the idea of telling me you just knew  the Wolfe girl by sight? Nunheim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I did, Lieutenent. That's the God's truth.  Maybe I said hello to her or how are you or something like that when I saw her, but that's all I knew her. That's the truth. (Marian laughs once, derisively. But there is no mirth in her face. Nunheim  twists around to face her) All right.  Put your mouth in and I'll pop a tooth out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings her arm around and lets the  skillet fly at his head.  It misses, crashing  into the wall.  Nunheim starts after her. Marian picks up a paring knife.  Nick puts  his foot out, without rising, and trips him. Nunheim falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out.  We didn't come here to watch you  two rough-house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunheim slowly gets up.  Marian starts for  the bedroom without looking at any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives me nuts.  She's been ragging me all  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you quit running around after other  women you wouldn't have so much trouble with  this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Marian's benefit - loud)  That's a lie, Lieutenant...  Anybody that says that is a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick)  Want to take a poke at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared, to Nick)  I didn't mean you, Mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian goes into the bedroom and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, now -- she can't hear you - Nunheim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (looking toward the door of the bedroom) You know how it is. A guy knocking around....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd done better to have told me that in the be- ginning.  Where were you the afternoon she was knocked off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)  You don't think I had anything to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian comes out.  She is in street clothes and is carrying a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like crooks and even if I did, I wouldn't like crooks that are stool pigeons, and if I did  like crooks that are stool pigeons, I still wouldn't  like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian starts for the outer door.  Nunheim  tries to follow Marian, but Guild catches his  arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian!  Marian! Don't go! I'll behave! I'll do anything!  Don't go, Marian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian goes out and shuts the door, paying no attention to Nunheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!  Let me bring her back. I can't get along without her. I'll bring her right back and I'll tell you anything you want to know.  Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down!  We didn't come here to watch you and  that broad dance around a May pole.  Where were you  the afternoon the girl was killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunheim puts his hand over his face and be- gins to cry. Nunheim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember offhand, Lieutenant.  Maybe I was  over at Charlie's shooting pool. Maybe I was here. She'd remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like to be thrown in the can on account of  not remembering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a minute....  I'll remember. I'm not stalling, Lieutenant.  You know I always come clean with you. (he has his head in his hands trying to remember. Guild looks at Nick and winks. Nunheim looks up, relieved.  He snaps his  fingers)  Gee, it'd serve me right if you had pinched me... that's the afternoon I was.... wait, I'll show you...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and quickly goes into the bedroom. Nick goes to the telephone and starts to dial. Guild starts to search the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're on the right track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling your office so you can send out a man to trail him. I want to see where he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild looks at Nick, who is grinning.  He then grasps what he means and makes a bee line for  the bedroom.  In a second he cones back. He takes the phone from Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, tell the boys to pick up Nunheim.   He just  left here - went out the fire escape  (then, as Bill evidently laughs, Guild  speaks with hurt dignity)  What's funny about that? (he hangs up and looks sheepishly over  towards Nick.)

dialogues.speaker: A TELEPHONE BOOTH.
dialogues.text: Nunheim is talking into the telephone.  As he talks, he watches the outside of the  telephone booth to be sure that no one is listening.  His voice is quiet but there is a menacing urgency in his tone. Nunheim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.  They been questionin' me again.  Asking me what more I know. Where I was that day.... Wait a minute.  I ducked out on 'em.  Now if you want me to play dumb, I want fi' thousand more... Fi' grand and I'll skip town today.... Where? O.K... Right away... See that you're there and have  it with you. He hangs up and turns to go out.

dialogues.speaker: STREET IN THE WEST FORTIES.
dialogues.text: Nunheim jumps out of cab, pays the driver. It drives off. The street is deserted. By  this time it is about five o'clock and the  early winter twilight has fallen.  WE TRUCK AND PAN as Nunheim looks at the numbers of the houses.  A little way up the street he finds the number he has been looking for. He walks into a dark doorway.  Just as he steps in, there is the crack of a pistol shot and the flash of fire from the gun. Nunheim throws up his hands, staggers forward to the street, his hand clutching his heart.  Here he pitches forward -- dead.  The CAMERA  stays on the body.

dialogues.speaker: LEFT OF ONE ARTHUR NUNHEIM
dialogues.text: The hands of Nick and Guild are examining the  clothes as we come in. Nick has taken a  card from the inside coat pocket. Nick's Voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over insert of card he holds) "Arthur Nunheim -- Honorary member --"

dialogues.speaker: GUILD'S OFFICE AT POLICE HEADQUARTERS.
dialogues.text: Guild is throwing down some letters and stuff he has extricated. Guild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, the policeman, comes in. Guild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)  Find out about that bullet yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  It's from the same gun that killed Julia Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a second of silence.  Guild and  Nick look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone rings.  Guild picks it up.  His face beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? -- No, we didn't get a thing. (he hands the phone to Nick)  It's your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reaches for the phone, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is in the Jorgensen apartment, but in a  room by herself. She speaks softly.  She  thinks she is still talking to Guild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've got something, Lieutenant.  I've been  doing a little detective work of my own.  That  flat foot I married thinks he's smart -- but I'm one jump ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: NICK.
dialogues.text: He plays straight in his best manner.  Nick (kidding her)

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: She starts at this, recognizing Nick's voice. Again she sticks up her nose, a little characteristic of hers in matters concerning Nickie.  Then she snaps:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lovely.  I'm having a copy made for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora's voice comes through, but she is evidently speaking in a low whisper and the words are inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hear you -- little lou -- (an alert look comes into his eyes as he  listens closer, getting what she is saying.  Guild, too, is interested.)  We'll be right up!  (Nick puts down the phone and turns to Guild)  She's up at Mimi's.  Jorgensen has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is seated facing Nick in her bedroom, al- though in this opening dissolve we do not  reveal him.  WE HOLD ON MIMI as she speaks  hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris may be at the club -- or somewhere -- I don't see that it's important --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have told them he'd disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL THE ROOM NOW as  Mimi jumps up.  Nick is seated, questioning  her.  Dorothy hovers behind Nick. Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her manner and tone more distrait)  But he has nothing to do with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not for you to decide. Everybody's under suspicion - especially running off like this -- (he picks up a picture of Jorgensen  from the bureau)  The police will want his description.  Is this a picture of him? Mimi tries to take the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you -- he didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll want more than your word for that. Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming forward and speaking slowly)  All right, then -- I'll tell them who did do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy turns and goes quickly from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy comes out of the bedroom, blind with horror at what her Mother is doing.  For a minute she stands there, trying to collect herself.  Andy comes from the living room,  where he has been waiting for her.  He goes to her and takes her in his arms. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with tremendous pity in his voice) Dorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a minute she clings to him, crying,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it.  You don't know..... Andy (protectively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, you can't go through any more of this. Now you get together your clothes and your skates and we'll go out to my family's in the country. Dorothy (she stops crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to get your mind off this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sweet, but the only thing that you can do  for me is to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't ever try to see me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!  You can't get mixed up in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  You don't know what's going to happen. Andy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only know I want to marry you... right now,  and -- Dorothy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't marry you!  I can't ever marry you!  Andy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you like to have a couple of little  murderers for your children?  It'd be fun, wouldn't it?  Maybe they'd murder each other... keep it all in the family.  That's what Father should have done.  He should have killed me and Gilbert... then we wouldn't have had this to go through.        Andy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking like a crazy person,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? I am crazy....the whole family's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy.... listen to me. I love you.  Don't you understand that?  I love you.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Nora and Guild are waiting for Nick.  Gil- bert is sitting with a large book open in his hand.  Dorothy's voice comes through. The three in the living room cannot help but hear. Dorothy's Voice (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away! A door slams.  Andy is seen walking slowly past the living room door, on his way out of the apartment.  Gilbert gets up and goes quickly out.  Nora looks at Guild and sighs. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleuthing isn't all fun, is it?  I feel so sorry for that poor girl -   Nick comes in with the photograph of Jorgen- sen, which he has taken from the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's ready to talk. (he hands Guild Jorgensen's photograph)  It won't do any harm, though - to find out where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy is lying on the bed, face down.  Gilbert walks up to her, his big book still  in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're wrong about all of your children being murderers...  I've studied the Mendelian Law of inheritance and their experiments with sweet  peas, and according to their findings... and they've  been pretty conclusive... only one out of four of  your children will be a murderer.  So the thing for  you to do would be to have just three children... (then as a thought comes to him) ... no, no.  That might not work  The first one might be the bad one.  I'll have to look that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this tine Dorothy gets up. She has a  defiant look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't look it up.  I'm not going to get married and I'm not going to have any children.  From now on, I'm just out for the ride!

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Mimi is showing Guild the watch chain.  Nick  is watching her closely. Nora is tense  with interest. Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice quivering with forced emotion) I took this from her hand.  It's Mr. Wynant's watch chain. (Guild takes it from her)  I wanted to protect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks into tears.  Nick looks over at her sardonically. Guild watches her with evident sympathy.  Guild gets up, putting the watch chain carefully in his handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that cinches it, eh, Mr. Charles?  He  killed them both - Julia Wolf and Nunheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty will still get you a hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling all cars - calling all cars - cover all roads leaving city - pick up Clyde Wynant - Clyde Wynant drag-net - pick up - etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A policeman stands at the gate scanning the  passengers as they go through. (Through  this and ensuing vignettes, the dull voice  of the Police Announcer continues over the  flashes.  Entire effect designed to ex-  citingly dramatize the spreading of the  net for the capture of Clyde Wynant.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is running off police placards announcing  the reward for the capture of Clyde Wynant. (d) TELETYPE MACHINE. Over the machine is coming: "Wynant wanted -- watch all stations -- boats and roads -- description - thin man -- six feet -- white hair, etc., etc."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (e) NEWSPAPER TRUCK -- STREET CORNER. Newsboys are crowded around the back of the  truck.  A man is hurling packs of LATE EXTRAS down to the boys.  They immediately begin calling out: NEWSBOYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Extra -- extra -- Wynant wanted in second murder --" "Five Star Final" -- Wynant's ex-wife produces mur- der evidence -- " "Extra - extra -- double murder charge against  Wynant --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures of Wynant, most of them full length  (for the desired effect of the tall, thin man) cover the front pages.  Second and third trucks can back into the scene, if desired.  Necessary, dramatically, to kick up the idea that the chase for the killer  is increasing to fever heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is at the window of their bedroom in the  hotel Normandie again.  We process through  the window to get a background of Central  Park, South.  On SOUND TRACK from below we  get a carry-over of the newsboys' "Extra!  Extra!" from preceding effects.  One shrill  voice is heard in relief against the others.  It is shouting: "Extra -- extra -- police hunt Wynant --" Nora listens for a second and then shuts the window, turning away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish they'd stop that.  It makes me fidgety. Do you think they'll find him, Nick?  He must be in New York.... (she stops short as CAMERA PULLS BACK  and she sees Nick is in his overcoat,  bending over Asta with a leash)  Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take Asta for a walk. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just been for a walk. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going sightseeing -- aren't we, Asta? He starts to go -- but Nora puts a hand on a  bulge in his overcoat pocket. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? (she puts her hand in and pulls out a bunch of skeleton keys)  What are you up to? (she puts her hand in and and pulls out a pistol - she unconsciously holds it, pointing at him)  Nickie - what is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got hunch.  I'm going down to look at Wynant's  shop, I want to find out why it's closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't be close it? He went away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went away lots of times when I knew him - but he never closed his shop. I've got a hunch something is  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, he might be hiding there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...  This thing has got my goat. I've got  to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick - I won't have you going down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you're the one who got me in this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but this is different.  He's a crazy man. He might kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right.  I've got Asta to protect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on - go on - see if I care.  But it's a dirty  trick bringing me all the way to New York just to make me a widow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be a widow long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the first time really serious) Nickie, take care of yourself won't you? Nick (lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it that way. Say it as if you meant it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, I believe the little woman cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care - I'm just used to you, that's all -- (Nick gives her an affectionate hug and a kiss. He calls to Asta. Nora turns to the  dog, trying to hide her emotion under a  pretense of clowning)  If you let anything happen to him, you'll never wag that tail again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is deserted. The light from the  street lamps is very dim.  A cab drives up before the shop.  The door of the cab opens and Asta jumps out, and makes a bee-line for a hydrant. Nick follows him, still in his evening clothes. He turns to pay he driver, who is looking  dubiously at the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure this is the place you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking apprehensively at the street)  You don't want me to wait, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a last look, he says dubiously) Well .... good luck! He drives off.  The street is quiet.  Nick  turns toward the shop.  Nick stands for a second looking at the building, then turns to Asta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the front door of the shop.  He tries it.  It is locked.  From his pocket he takes out a ring with skeleton keys on it. Holding his flashlight on the key hole, he finally finds the key that opens it.  He  pushes the door slowly open.  He holds it  open, looking back at Asta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep quiet now. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Asta doesn't like the looks of the place. He doesn't move.  Nick snaps his fingers for him to come and Asta finally, reluctantly follows him.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR BUILDING
dialogues.text: On Nick as he makes his way down the narrow little hall, guided by his flashlight.  Asta  trails, still reluctantly.  Nick is  familiar with the old building so that he  does not lose time in reaching the rear,  where he goes down the steps, cautiously, to  the basement.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE SHOP AND STOREROOM IN BASEMEN
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT.  (This room leads to Wynant's  private work-shop as established earlier.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves stealthily through the storeroom,  flashing his light here and there on crates,  boxes of machinery, etc.  It is a weird scene,  at any moment you must feel that Wynant, or  some foe will spring from behind the objects.  (His figure is mostly in silhouette during, the scene.  He flashes his light in quick  short flashes.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sees a moving shadow.  Asta starts to  growl.  Nick whips out his gun.  The throws  the light of his flashlight onto a pile of [sorry -- page missing. The "moving shadow"  turns out to be a cat.]

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: nothing that will help him. He is starting  out, when he misses Asta. He calls him softly. We hear the dog whine. Nick (to Asta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come along, then... Still the dog does not come. We hear him whine again.  Nick flashes his light around until it lights on the dog.  Asta is in the center of the floor.  He has his ears back. He is sniffing at the floor. Nick keeping  his flashlight on Asta, comes back.  He leans down to the floor, running his hand over  the cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a Scottish Terrier.  You're a police  dog.  New cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up briskly and looks around, using  his flashlight, to find a tool.  He finds an iron bar.  Placing the light so that it falls on the floor.  Nick takes the iron bar.  He pounds on the floor.  Over the place where  Asta was whining, the cement gives out a  hollow sound.  Nick takes the bar in both  hands, throws his whole strength into it,  trying to force it through the floor.  It  finally goes through.  Nick leans down, and a startled, horrified look comes in his face.  He puts down the bar, picks up Asta, who is  flattened on the floor, watching him, takes  his flashlight and goes quickly toward the  stairs.  He climbs rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses his flashlight to find his way. The stairway, being as old as the building, creaks as he walks.  WE CONTINUE TO CRANE until he reaches the second floor and cautiously enters  the old office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is pitch dark as he follows his flashlight to the telephone, dials the number, then extinguishes the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Lieutenant Guild, please... John?  This is  Charles.  I'm up in Wynant's shop.  Well, I've found something... it's a body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down the telephone.  Using his  flashlight, he goes to the desk and begins  to look through the papers there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the figure of a man as it is quietly  going up the same stairway that Nick took,  slowly going toward the office.  He has no  light, but by his unhesitating steps, we gather  that he is familiar with the building. The  steps creak a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is still rummaging over the desk.  Sudden- ly he stands rigid.  He has heard a step.  He puts out his flashlight and whirls around  to face the door.  At this instant, CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the man's figure appears.  As he starts  to come in, Nick's flashlight is thrown  full on his face, blinding him.  We see  that it is Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner, terrified by the light and the sharp  command from the darkness, puts up his hands.  Asta begins to bark.  Keeping the light full on Tanner's face, Nick swiftly  searches him.  Satisfied that Tanner has  no gun, Nick goes to an electric light  switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make a move or that dog will tear you to  shreds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches on the light.  Tanner looks in, blinking amazement and fear, first at Nick,  and then at --

dialogues.speaker: ASTA
dialogues.text: He has crawled under the desk and lies there, looking out fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIUM ON NICK AND TANNER
dialogues.text: Nick grins a little at Asta's fear and  Tanner's bewilderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on out, now.  He won't hurt you. (then to Tanner, with a return of his  brisk, professional tone)  Back to your old tricks, eh, Tanner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a key. I worked here... till they closed the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Julia Wolf got me a job as bookkeeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a hot one.  You a bookkeeper!  When  were you ever a bookkeeper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That time you sent me up last ... I learned book- keeping at Sing Sing.  I figured it might be an in  for me somewheres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewheres where they might go out and leave the safe open? Tanner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest, Mr, Charles.  I never touched that safe.  Them bonds that were missing... Julia took them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to put it off on her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Charles - she did - that's why he got sore at  her and killed her.  Listen, Mr. Charles -- (he pulls out some bills)  I did do a little chiseling.  I come to bring it  back and fix up the books.  I didn't want him to  find out and come after me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can save that and tell it to the police. They'll be here in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hunted look comes into his face) Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrinks back, aghast, as at this moment we  hear the sound of sirens from police cars  arriving outside.  Asta crawls back under  the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a rising crescendo of sirens as  Guild's police car, and the Medical Examiner's  car swing around the corner, accompanied by a  motorcycle escort.  They pull to a stop at the front of the shop.  The police and Dr. Walton, with his assistant, get out of the  cars and go to the door of the building.  There are police photographers with them.  Nick, with Tanner in his custody, is waiting at the door of the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is dug up more than in the last scene, so that the body is exposed enough for the photographers.  Guild, Nick, Dr. Walton, Tanner and the rest of the police stand aside  as the photographers take their flashlight  pictures from different angles.  Guild is  putting on a pair of gloves.  Dr. Walton is  preparing to do his work.  Nick, in his  evening clothes and his casual air, is an  incongruous note in the midst of all the professional excitement.  As the photographers finish, Guild steps up to the hole in the  floor.  He turns to Tanner, who is watching, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know anything about all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.... Guild (to one of the police)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him down to the can.  I'll see him later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman goes out with Tanner. Guild  looks down into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what Wynant had against this one? Quick lime. Well at least the clothes weren't touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Medical Examiner comes up and stands be- side him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I take those out, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild stoops down and takes out a bundle of  clothes.  The CAMERA PANS with him as he  takes them over to a work table and starts  to open them up.  Nick strolls over and stands  watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the bundle of clothes)  Just rolled them up and threw them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky thing for us they weren't in that lime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild pulls a coat from the bundle.  It is  a large coat, slightly eaten by the lime.  Guild picks it up and examines it for a  tailor's label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - no identification - (he holds the coat up)  Must have weighed two hundred and fifty if he  weighed an ounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob comes into the scene.  He hands Guild a walking stick.  Guild takes it and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubber tip.  He must have been lame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't be.... carrying that weight around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild takes the trousers and stretches  them out.
