dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing straight he'd be about five foot, eleven, wouldn't he? Doctor's Voice (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About. There is a belt attached to the trousers -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild looks at it. He finds some initials engraved on the silver buckle.

dialogues.speaker: "D.W.R."
dialogues.text: (turns to Nick) That case you worked on... the guy who threatened to kill Wynant... what what was his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw him.  I don't think anyone saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said Wynant tried to steal an invention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  But we figured it was just blackmail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the same, Wynant wouldn't mind having him  out of the way, would he? (he turns to the Doctor)  How long should you say this body'd been here, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor comes into the scene taking  off his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say offhand.  At least a couple of months...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of months.  That's just when he closed the shop.  The way I figure it is... he kills this guy  and plants him here.  Julia knows about it, so he  kills her.  And Nunheim caught him at that, so he  he had to bump off Nunheim. (he makes a bundle of the clothes) Well, we'll be going along. (to Nick)  You done a swell job.  You wouldn't like to pay me that hundred now?  Nick (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks over to the Medical Examiner who is putting on his coat, preparatory to going. The Medical Examiner speaks to his assistant,  indicating the wrapped up body, out of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take that out to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to run him through the floroscope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I come down and see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very interested in that body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this time Guild is ready to go.  He turns  to Nick, the bundle of clothes under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give my best to your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go out, almost bumping into a  figure in the semi-darkness. It is apparently a slender boy, his coat collar high about his  neck, and his hat pulled down over his eyes.  Nick spies him at the same time and comes  toward him.  Guild speaks sharply to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Guild - knowing who it is) I'll take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guild grunts and continues on his way.  Nick  takes the boy by the arm, and unceremoniously  hustles him out.  Nick has Asta under his other arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hustles the boy into a taxicab, and  follows him in, speaking to the driver as he  gets in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick is seated in the cab.  He is looking with  a disapproving scowl at his companion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS to his companion.  We see that  it is Nora.  She is dressed in Nick's clothes.  She has even used some of her hair to make a mustache.  She looks at Nick with a twinkle in her eye, and strokes the points of her  mustache in imitation of him as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light of the floroscope comes through the skeleton of the body.  The Medical Examiner's hand comes into the shot, point- ing to a dark spot in the left side of the body, near the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the bullet he was killed with.  See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand comes into the shot, pointing to a smaller speck in the shin bone.  THE CAMERA  NOW PULLS back to show the two men in Dr. Walton's laboratory looking at the body under  the floroscope.  Dr. Walton looks closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just an old piece of shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idea comes to Nick.  He is piecing things  together in his mind. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been in the war.  That might account for the cane and his limp. Nick (thinking of something else)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In terrific tempo, with the elongated shadow  of the Thin Man behind the flashes, we bring in, kaleidoscopically, police teletypes -- radio broadcasts -- telephone and telegraph -- wireless -- radio cars, etc.  Chief among  these effects are superimposed closeups of  police and detective chiefs as they talk  into phones, firing their orders.  By the nature of the uniforms worn by the police captains, we must achieve the idea that the man-hunt is NATION WIDE. Also superimposed are newspaper headlines, tabloids, etc., screaming out: "WYNANT HUNTED IN THIRD MUR-

dialogues.speaker: "HORROR MURDER LAID TO WYNANT --" "WYNANT
dialogues.text: BODY NUMBER THREE DUG UP IN CEMENT --" etc., etc. Also, on SOUND TRACK, through radio and telephone, we hear continuous voices as  they report: "WYNANT SEEN HERE -- WYNANT  SEEN THERE --" etc. These are Vorkapich shots, and conclude with thrilling flashes of automobiles being stopp- ed on roads by traffic officers, squad cars racing to and fro from headquarters, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog is standing on a table. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to show the living room of Nick's  suite.  The reporters are on Nick's trail  again.  The floor is littered with newspapers.  Nora, in negligee, is being interviewed  by a 'sob sister'.  Nick is near the table where the drinks are surrounded by reporters.  A newspaper photographer is taking  Asta's  picture as he stands on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping his fingers down near  the floor) Hey... doggie, doggie.  Look down at the body! Look down at the body! (Asta looks down at the man's hand and the flashlight flares up. The photo- grapher hurriedly goes to Nick) Now, Mr. Charles -- 1st Reporter (to photographer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be lovely for the woman's page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick goes to stand beside Nora, and the  photographer puts Asta in Nora's arms. The  reporters follow Nick, asking him questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the police got any idea where Wynant is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they'll I find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlights flare again.  Nick moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got anything else to say about the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's put me way behind in my drinking. He starts for the table where the liquor is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's get it in.  (to Nick) Thanks, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters all start for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your next step, Nick? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right back to California.  We've got to go home and rest up from our vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you before you go. They all go out.  CAMERA MOVES IN FOR  CLOSE PANNING SHOT. Nora (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My soul, woman.  I give you three murders and  you aren't satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to stay and find Wynant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of a clear sky - over his highball)  I did find him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was down in the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was his body that was buried there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you'd better lay off that liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.  Don't you want something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they all said it was Rosebreen's. Nick (going to telephone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they think... Guild and all of them. They take it for granted that it's just another of Wynant's victims. (he takes up telephone) Guild's hot-footing it around now, looking for Wynant. That's all that troubles him. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure it's Wynant's body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several things. (speaks into the telephone)  Hello, Fred.  We're hungry again.  Yeah, and lots of onions.  Oh, and coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you'll drive me crazy.  What things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things made you so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, the clothes for instance. They were  carefully preserved, and the body was just as  carefully destroyed.  The person who killed him  counted on one thing... that all skeletons look  alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a drink from the glass in his hand.  Nora goes to him and takes his drink from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get another swallow 'til you really open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: get his drink back) I remembered that Wynant had some shrapnel in his shin.  It often bothered him.  So I looked for it and I found it.  (he reaches out his hand for the glass) Gimme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora mechanically gives him back his drink,  her mind on the significance of what he has  told her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has he been dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he couldn't have committed those other mur- ders. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wynant dead?  (with a sudden thought) Does Dorothy know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Nobody but you. Nora starts for the telephone. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... hey. (Nora stops) Don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the poor kid's going crazy.  She'd rather know her father was dead than that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. I can't tell a soul.  I didn't  even tell Guild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to lie low till I get the whole dope.  I  don't want to go off half-cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get the real murderer.  I've got  an idea.  Want to see me take him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Nick, what's that got to do with it?  Nick (insisting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to give a party, and invite all of the suspects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they'll come.  I'll have Guild issue the invitations. (he starts to telephone) Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi, Jorgensen, Morelli, Tanner..... (to Nora)  What were you doing on the ninth of June?

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE DINING ROOM IN HOTEL.
dialogues.text: Music of a small string orchestra is com- ing from the adjoining balcony.  A table is set in the background for fourteen people.  The waiters are quietly putting the the last  touches to the table.  The head waiter is passing around a last tray of cocktails.  The CAMERA TRUCKS with him as we pick up the different people.  He goes first to Andrew who is standing by himself, very forlorn looking.  Then to Mimi, Tanner and Gilbert  who are a little isolated group.... not know- ing what is going on, and looking very  suspiciously at the other guests.  He goes  on to a group made up of Nora, Guild, Marian and Morelli.  Nora is hanging on to the two men's words. The head waiter goes on to Nick and Macaulay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks toward the door.  He breaks away  from Macaulay and goes to the door.  The CAMERA PANS with him as he goes.  A detec- tive is just coming in the door. Detective (to Nick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got 'em.  Picked 'em up at the Pennsylvania  Station. (he turns to the door) Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy and Quinn come into the room.  They have both been drinking.  Quinn is angry  and reluctant to come in.  Quinn has a suit- case and Dorothy a little dressing-case in her hand.  Dorothy is defiantly gay.  She  has quite thoroughly carried out her threat to go "out for the ride" -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dorothy. (Nick reaches out and takes her bag) Dorothy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nick! (she looks around the room)  And a party - celebrating father's third murder - (her tone is bitter)  Mimi's  Voice (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks toward the drinks out of the scene. Nick (to Quinn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were trying to make a get-away,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were doing nothing of the sort.  What's the  idea of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't he... (he indicates the detective) ...give you my invitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective is closing in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're perfectly right. (to the detective)  Take the gentleman's coat and bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective starts, not too gently to take Quinn's coat from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy takes a drink from the waiter.  Andy starts toward her. Dorothy (to Andy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a pretty dead bunch, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you interrupted me at a very important  point in my life.  I was about to take my first  false step. (calling to Quinn)  Come on, Quinny. Let's dance -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away from Andy and Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I stay, I know I'll take a poke at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I insist that you stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some more of that tiger milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts off to get another drink.  Morelli  looks after her admiringly. Morelli (to Guild)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think somebody could do something with that cl[] if they took hold of her right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora is near the dinner table with Guild beside her.  Marian, Macaulay, Mimi, Gilbert, Tanner and Morelli are nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we may as well sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess all the suspects are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a second of stunned amazement on the people's faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Guild means guests!  (counting noses)  Oh, there are two more to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here.  Don't worry.  My men are pick- ing them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great help to a hostess.  I wish I  always had you for my dinner parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora starts to seat the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks rapidly out of the scene, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorgensen and a woman have come in the door.  She is a hard-faced, common woman, who looks as if she could handle any situation.  They  are standing there angry and belligerent. There are a couple or plain-clothesmen with them. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Nick Charles. How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops as she sees the other woman.  One of the plain-clothesmen speaks to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry we're late.  But they had to break down  the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi bristles at this.  She gives the woman a withering look and walks out of  the scene. Nick watches with great amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two reluctantly follow him further into the  room.  Nick follows them, rubbing his hands with delighted anticipation of the scene to  follow.  The CAMERA PANS WITH HIM as goes  to the table.  The people are all seated with the exception of Mimi, Jorgensen and the woman with him, and Nick.  Nora is watching the new arrivals with eager interest.  Nick looks at her and gives her a broad wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jorgensen, you sit next to Andrew, and Mrs.  Jorgensen on your right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Mimi and the woman who came in with  Jorgensen, start for the chair which Jor- gensen is holding.  As they find themselves both going for the same chair, Mimi draws herself up with great dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mrs. Jorgensen.  Mimi starts to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman (drily, as she points to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an empty chair across the table)  Put it over there.  I was Mrs. Jorgensen before  you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi looks at Jorgensen, bewildered.  But he  refuses to meet her eye.  The other woman sits down firmly in the chair.  Nick, from the head of the table, calls to Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi.... you're here on my right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her chair for her as she comes and sits down.  The waiters start in immediately to serve dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick holds Nora's chair for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give such charming parties, Mr. Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mrs. Charles. Nora sits - she whispers to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait any longer.  Tell me, do you think one of them did it? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd tell me who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits down at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOTE:  The seating of the table is as follows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi        Nora Quinn       Macaulay Dorothy     Tanner Gilbert     1st Mrs. Jorgensen Morelli     Jorgensen Marian      Andy Guild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks up and down the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all very pleasant but why are here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some very important news - I've seen  Wynant. They all turn and look at him with curiosity. Guild looks amazed. Mimi is very composed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nothing.  I saw him myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Nora exchange looks.  Nora is be- wildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night.  He came to see me at my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, did he?  What did he say? Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say very much.  Wanted to know how I was  and how the children were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ped through his fingers) What kind of clothes was he wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brown suit, brown shoes and a white shirt and a grayish tie with red, or reddish brown figures on  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who is standing behind his chair) Tell 'em. (Bob goes quickly out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him too... he was wearing a green suit with  a white tie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Gilbert?  You weren't there! Gilbert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  But I saw him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gazing in my crystal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serve the nuts - I mean, serve the guests the nuts. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're lying, Mimi.  You see, I really did see Wynant last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? .... Why didn't you hold  him? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I found out for certain that he didn't commit the murders. Dorothy (sobering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do it -- Nick! Macaulay (puzzled))

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean to say...?  etc.  ) Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him have his say out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morelli - (Morelli jumps, startled.  Everybody looks at him) You knew Julia.  Was she gypping Wynant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't say she is, but I figure she is -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I wanted five grand -- (snaps his fingers) Cash - Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Now I'll tell you why I know Wynant didn't commit those murders - (he turns to Morelli)  Three months ago - the night that he caught you  in Julia's apartment, he found out that Julia was  cheating him, and was splitting with some man.   He went to find the man.  That man was.... Tanner, don't you...? (but poor Tanner, thinking that Nick is naming him as the man, spills his soup over everything.  Everybody turns and looks suspiciously at him. Nick sees that he has startled him and apologizes) I'm sorry.  Tanner, don't you want some wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in back of him) No... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to drive me crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see... where was I?  Oh, yes.  He went to find the man.  That man was desperate!  He knew that he was caught dead to rights -- and with  prison staring him in the face, he took the only way out.  He killed Wynant. (Nick turns to Dorothy and speaks gently, trying to soften the blow)  It's terrible to tell you this way but your  father's dead, Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been dead for three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks down and cries.  She gets up from the table.  Nora starts to go to her. but Andy is there before her.  He takes Dorothy in his arms, oblivious of the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: people in the room and comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, don't cry.  Please.  I know it's  terrible.  But isn't it really better this way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting her arms around Andy) Oh, Andy, Andy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better take her home.  Your home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks over at Nick.  Nick motions him  to take her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his arms around her, he starts out of the room.  Dorothy clings to him as they go out.  Quinn gets up to follow.  There is a silence in the room for a minute after they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's going wrong now, she's going wrong right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we need you any more now.  I'm  deeply sorry that I spoiled your trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn grabs his hat and coat and bag - goes  out.  Nick and Nora return to the table. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, everybody. Eat up. You're not eating.   It hasn't affected Mimi's appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't believe that Clyde's dead!  Why, you said yourself you saw him last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I did.  I saw him lying buried in his shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the murderer is right here in this room to- night... he's sitting at this table.  (to waiter)  You may serve the fish. The CAMERA PANS around the table... to all the frightened faces of the people.  Morelli jumps up and starts out of the door... but he is stopped by the police.  Morelli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to pin this one on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I?  The fall guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick (to the table full of people)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you won't let this news spoil  your dinner. (he turns to Nora) Nice food, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the best diner I ever listened to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to keep us in the dark, are you?  Tell us -- who is it? Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (There is more consternation at that) But I thought if we all had a little get-together we might be able to find out.  I'll tell you as  much as I know.  Go right on eating.  This murder- er is a very clever.  He studied this thing out very carefully.  You'd understand that, wouldn't  you, Gilbert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He planned the whole thing beautifully. After he killed Wynant he wired Macaulay, using Wynant's name and told him to shut up the shop.  He destroyed all of Wynant's clothes, with the ex- ception of his watch chain.  He figured that some  day that might come in handy.  Then he took  Wynant's body and buried it in the shop with  another man's clothes to throw us off the track.  He even put a belt buckle with an "R" on it, hop- ing that we'd think it was Rosebreen -- an old  enemy of Wynant's who dropped out of sight years ago.  (He looks over at Morelli) Morelli - would you mind holding your knife  another way?  You're worrying Gilbert.  (Morelli, who has been holding his knife as if it were a dagger, gives Gilbert a  disdainful look, and shifts his knife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that knife is missing, I'll look for it in your back.  Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After our hero had killed Wynant, he got a brilliant idea.  He realized that he and Julia could still collect money.  Wynant was supposed to be on a trip - no one knew where - so our dinner guest wrote letters to Macaulay, signing Wynant's name,  so that Macaulay would continue to send the money  to Julia.  He even telephoned Macaulay -- (to Macaulay)  Do you remember?.... the first day that you came to see me... he telephoned that he was in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it must have been Wynant.  I should have known if it weren't his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he as clever about that.  He called when you  were out.  That same afternoon, Julia telephoned to him. She said that you were coming, Mimi, to ask about Wynant.  He got terrified. He was afraid that  Julia would break down and tell... so he went to  Julia and killed her and left Wynant's watch chain  in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way it makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His plan was still working beautifully. Wynant  was established as being in town.  The watch chain was handed over.... (with a look at Mimi)  ...with a slight delay...to the police. The only hitch was a man named Nunheim who had found out something.  Our hero paid Nunheim once to keep  his mouth shut, and when Nunheim threatened him  again, he bumped him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say that to me for?  Guild (to both)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, he'd been very clever. Everybody,  even our astute friend Guild, thought that Wynant was alive and that he was the murderer.  But  our hero had just one weak link in his chain. The telegrams, wires and telephones were all very  well - but no one had seen Wynant.  So he picked on poor Mimi here to strengthen his case.  Mimi is the only one at the table who can tell us  who the real murderer is. (everybody looks at Mimi) Mimi, who was it that told you to say you'd seen  Wynant? Mimi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody told me.  I did see him! Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he pay you, Mimi, to stick to that story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't a story - it's true.  I did see Wynant. He's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying, Mimi.  But then, you'd do anything  for money.  You're getting a good price for say- ing you saw Wynant and you figure you won't get  anything if he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lot going to stay here to be insulted - (she starts to go - but stops to listen  to Nick as he continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macaulay, you drew up Wynant's will.  Mimi was cut off, wasn't she, if she re-married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no right to answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it, Tanner.  Isn't that the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Mr. Wynant said to me.  If she re- married, all the money was to go to the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't let that keep you from telling  truth, Mimi.  Mrs. Jorgensen - (he speaks to the woman with Jorgensen)  Were you ever divorced from Chris Jorgensen ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you see, Mimi, under the law, you haven't re- married.  You're still one of the heirs.  What  are you holding out for?  A few crummy dollars  that that man gave you when you can get the whole  estate?  Remember the other two who were in with him on this... Julia and Nunheim.  When he thought they might spill something he bumped them off. You ought to know damn well that he's not going  to take any chances on you. What do you want to  do?  Be next on his list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dirty son of a b----- ! A crash of china drowns out the end of her speech as Macaulay rises to his feet.  Nick is on his feet in a minute.  He knocks Macaulay out.  Guild rises and stands look- ing down in stunned amazement at Macaulay. Nora and all the others leap up in amaze- ment as the murderer is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?  Wrap him in cellophane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small travelling Victrola is playing a gay  tune.  The glasses are held up by four hands. WE DISSOLVE THROUGH them to show the drawing  room of a train.  Dorothy and Nora are  sitting facing each other, dressed in robes  and lounging pajamas, and Andy and Nick  are sitting beside them, also in robes and  pajamas.  Nick is pouring champagne from a bottle into the four glasses.  The drawing room is full of flowers.  Nick puts down the bottle and holds up his glass in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER THE SOUND TRACK we hear the train whistle  go "Toot-toot" at a crossing.  The four raise their glasses in a toast and drink.  There is a buzz at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come! A good-natured colored porter sticks his head in the door and speaks to Nick. Porter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  You can take Asta now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Asta is lying asleep.  She picks him  up. Nora (to Asta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to your nice little bed in the  baggage car. She hands the dog to the porter.  As the por- ter is starting out, he sees Dorothy's bridal bouquet in the bracket in the corner of the drawing room. Porter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dorothy, pointing to the bridal bouquet) Shall I keep them fresh for you? Dorothy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, if you will. The porter takes the flowers and Asta and goes out.  There is a pause.  Simultaneously,  Andy and Nick sneak a look at the wrist watches.  Andy looks up and catches Nick looking at his.  Nick is embarrassed but determined to call Nora's attention to the  late hour. Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well set it ahead now. Nick starts to set his watch.  Nora leans over, is startled to see how late it is. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracious!  One o'clock.  We'd better go. She leans over Dorothy and kisses her  affectionately. Nora

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy clings to Nora for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can never thank you enough for all you've  done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Nick (to Andy and Dorothy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.  Goodnight. There are mingled "good nights" as Nick and  Nora go out the door.  As soon as the door  closes, Andy takes Dorothy in his arms. Andy (smiling -- shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they'd never leave. He kisses Dorothy affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND NORA'S DRAWING ROOM.
dialogues.text: Nick is closing the door of their room.  As soon as it snaps shut.... they are in each  other's arms. Nick (smiling... but not shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd never leave. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BAGGAGE CAR
dialogues.text: As he enters, Asta on one arm, flowers in the other.  He is about to put Asta down on the blanket for the night when he stops -- looks o.s.  CAMERA PANS OVER to show another dog of the same breed as Asta in a small crate.  The dog is looking up at Asta eager- ly.  And Asta's ears go up and his tail begins to wag as he anticipates the possi- bilities of a transcontinental romance. Porter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting it) Asta -- meet Fifi -- And he puts Asta into the crate with Fifi .... places the BRIDAL BOUQUET on top of the crate ... turns and shuffles out as we are --
